name: unseparated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not having been separated or divided: This is a sponge cake made with well-beaten unseparated eggs. The new waste processing plant will take in 100,000 tonnes of unseparated waste a year. Compare
undivided
More examplesFewer examplesThe unseparated samples were oven-dried, weighed, and ground.Unseparated recyclables are put into the blue bins - the recyclables are separated at the sorting centres.The plutonium is currently unseparated from the rest of the spent fuel.Sentences often run on from one another, unseparated by full stops or other punctuation marks.
